ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Family history of psychiatric conditions in the participant's blood relatives?
Psychiatric Condition 1: degree of relation
Notes: 1= First-degree relative; 2= Second-degree relative; 3= Third-degree relative; 4= Other blood relationship

ElementDescription: Psychiatric Condition 1: lineage
Psychiatric Condition 1: diagnosis category
Psychiatric Condition 1: diagnosis
Psychiatric Condition 1: evidence
Notes: 1= Participant's word; 2= Confirmed by relative; 3= Confirmed by medical professional or medical record

Psychiatric Condition 1: Psychiatric Condition 1: degree of relation
Notes: 1= First-degree relative; 2= Second-degree relative; 3= Third-degree relative; 4= Other blood relationship
